meanings.definition: Shocked or amazed by something unexpected or astonishing.
meanings.sent1: The kids were thunderstruck when they saw a magician make a rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent2: She was thunderstruck by the beautiful sunset at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked thunderstruck when it saw a cat for the first time.
meanings.sent4: His thunderstruck expression made it clear he had never seen such a sight before.
meanings.sent5: The students were thunderstruck by the incredible science experiment.

meanings.definition: To be struck by lightning and experience a sudden shock or amazement.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the tree was thunderstruck by a bolt of lightning.
meanings.sent2: He was thunderstruck by the unexpected news of winning the lottery.
meanings.sent3: The idea of traveling to space thunderstruck him with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was thunderstruck with joy when she saw her long-lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The town was thunderstruck by the sudden arrival of a famous celebrity.
